alert.note: Alert for Allen; Elk; Greenwood; Neosho; Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 09 at 4:42PM CDT until May 09 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wichita has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Elk County in southeastern Kansas... Wilson County in southeastern Kansas... Northwestern Neosho County in southeastern Kansas... Woodson County in southeastern Kansas... Greenwood County in southeastern Kansas... Allen County in southeastern Kansas... * Until 615 PM CDT. * At 441 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Hamilton, or 7 miles northeast of Eureka, moving southeast at 30 mph. 70 mph winds are occurring well ahead of the precipitation area, along the leading gust front. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Chanute, Iola, Eureka, Fredonia, Humboldt, Yates Center, Howard, La Harpe, Gas, Moran, Altoona, Moline, Longton, Toronto, Hamilton, Severy, Buffalo, Grenola, Fall River and Neosho Falls. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Allen; Elk; Greenwood; Neosho; Wilson; Woodson
